item.title: AppliBugs and applications of Bayesian theory
item.description: We held AppliBugs in Montpellier, with the idea to stimulate exchanges and to share information on Bayesian methods and applications (program here). The day went well despite a rainstorm falling on Montpellier. All talks were great, and I was particularly interested in Adrien Todeschini’s presentation of Biips, a software allowing the implementation of state-space models using particle filtering and a R/BUGS-like syntax.
